comments:
This is a regression, it was working in previous 1.0.2 builds.

When a 2ee module (ejb jar, war etc.) is imported, and you specify that it should be added to an already existing ear project,  an exception is written to the standard output (not the .log file) and the custom facets which should be applied to the imported module are not applied.

Here is the exception stack trace.

I haven't been able to reproduce this.  I created several EARs each with different server targets, and then tried importing various EJB.jars and addinging them to each of the existing EARs as well as creating new EARs.  The way I fixed the original bug bug # 134776 was by ensuring the DataModel was correctly setting the server target up front to match that of the EAR.  This way when the newly created project is added to the EAR its server target does not need to be modified.  You should notice that when you select an existing EAR that the UI sets the server target to that of the EAR and disables the combo.  Somehow, I suspect this got out of synch, but I can't figure out how.
Yes.  I grabed the latest 1.0.2 driver and latest code from cvs.

Here is the problem:

In J2EEComponentCreationDataModelProvider.propertySet(), it calls

   setProperty(RUNTIME_TARGET_ID, facetdEarProject.getRuntime().getName());

which sets the RUNTIME_TARGET_ID to the name of a facet runtime, but in

   J2EEComponentCreationFacetOperation.setRuntime(),

it tries to find a server runtime which has this as its ID, and from that, it tries to find the corresponding facet runtime.  This will actually work if the server runtime id and the corresponding facet runtime name are the same, but that is not guaranteed to be true.

The fix depends on whether RUNTIME_TARGET_ID should identify a server runtime or a facet runtime.  If it should identify a facet runtime, then

   J2EEComponentCreationFacetOperation.setRuntime()

just needs to call RuntimeManager.getRuntime() to get the facet runtime, but if RUNTIME_TARGET_ID is supposed to identify a server runtime, then the code in 

   J2EEComponentCreationDataModelProvider.propertySet()

needs to change, to use server.core FacetUtil to find the corresponding server runtime for the facet runtime.

John P., thanks for finding the root of the problem.

John L., could you route this as appropriate? The data models should never refer to wst.server.core runtimes. It should only refer to faceted project runtimes. In fact we need to eliminate all references to wst.server.core runtimes from j2ee team's code...
+1 for WTP 1.0.3 - fix is well understood.
*** Bug 143146 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

traces.message: Cannot modify faceted project from within a facet delegate.
